top_comments.comment:
During your upcoming emulation test, would you consider trying out “Hot Wheels: Ultimate Racing” for the PSP?
I’ve been looking for a way to play that game on the go, and this new PowKiddy handheld seems like the right way to go (price notwithstanding).

comments_since_last_sample.body: Let's be honest here. Even a 3 year old random $30 Android box can match this performance. Nothing else about it screams $170 either. There's literally no reason to buy a new device if you already bought one in the last 3 years as they all performs nearly identically. What looks like performance upgrades on paper is in real life use so miniscule that nothing has changed in 3 years. Some ACTUAL hardware upgrades is needed, next gen upgrades, PS2 and Gamecube performance. Especially now when these high-end handheld devices like Steam Deck are being released, something needs to fill the huge gap.
Can you make a video on MAME on android (Samsung Galaxy tab 7+)
